definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to receive no news whatsoever about sb

sentences.english: And why haven't we heard from them yet?
sentences.chinese: 为什么我们还没有他们的音信呢？

sentences.english: Switch off your phone and allow messages to go to voicemail.
sentences.chinese: 将你手机关机，让信息转到语音信箱。

sentences.english: I haven't heard of him ofr ages; perhaps he is not alive now.
sentences.chinese: 我多年没有他的音信，或许他现在已不在人世。

sentences.english: Don't believe anything through the grapevine. There will plus much more gossipers.
sentences.chinese: 不要听任何小道音信，现在传闲话的人越来越多了。

sentences.english: I haven't heard from Zhang Min for half a year.
sentences.chinese: 我已经有半年没有张明的音信了。

sentences.english: The Huntley surfaced, signalled her success, and was never heard from again.
sentences.chinese: 亨特利号浮上水面，发出成功信号，但从此再无音信。

sentences.english: You also might want to consider touching base with some old friends you’ve lost contact with.
sentences.chinese: 你可能也会想要和那些音信久失的老朋友联系上。

sentences.english: There was still no sign of Clara.
sentences.chinese: 仍然没有克拉拉的音信。

sentences.english: I tried. The line was busy. I left a message in his voice mail box.
sentences.chinese: 我试过，忙线中，我己经在语音信箱里留话了。

sentences.english: Can I apply for a V-mail here ?
sentences.chinese: 我可以申请一个语音信箱吗？

sentences.english: Would you like to leave a message on his voice mail，then？
sentences.chinese: 那您要不要留话在他的语音信箱里？

sentences.english: Once I got voicemail. But usually it rings off the hook.
sentences.chinese: 有一次我接通了语音信箱，但是通常电话都无人接听。

sentences.english: I'm lost now without you, I don't know where you are.
sentences.chinese: 你的音信全无，但你总随着我的心跳打动我。

sentences.english: We had not heard from him since the Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor.
sentences.chinese: 自从日本袭击珍珠港以后，他就一直杳无音信。

sentences.english: Do you ever leave messages for people on their voice mail?
sentences.chinese: 你在他们的语音信箱留过言吗？

sentences.english: He shaved the faces of gentlemen, who never thereafter wereheardof again.
sentences.chinese: 被他刮过脸的绅士们，从此杳无音信。

definition: see 杳無音信|杳无音信[yao3 wu2 yin1 xin4]
to receive no news whatsoever about sb
lit. to throw a stone and see it sink without trace in the sea (idiom)/fig. to elicit no response
to take a letter/to send word
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
not to see/not to meet/to have disappeared/to be missing
